name: Petronas Twin Towers
description: Iconic 88-story twin skyscrapers dominating Kuala Lumpur's skyline
notes: Book observation deck tickets online in advance to skip lines.

name: Batu Caves
description: Ancient Hindu temple complex built inside massive limestone caves
notes: 272 colorful steps to climb. Wear comfortable shoes and watch for monkeys.

name: KL Tower
description: 421m telecommunications tower with observation deck and revolving restaurant
notes: Sky deck offers 360Â° views. Less crowded than Petronas - good alternative.

name: Jalan Alor
description: Vibrant night food street lined with outdoor hawker stalls
notes: Opens after 6pm. Must-try: grilled chicken wings and satay skewers.

name: Central Market
description: 1930s art deco building housing Malaysian arts and crafts market
notes: Excellent for souvenirs and local handicrafts. Air-conditioned shopping.

name: Merdeka Square
description: Historic square where Malaysian independence was declared in 1957
notes: Best photos at sunrise. Surrounded by beautiful colonial-era buildings.

name: Islamic Arts Museum
description: Southeast Asia's largest museum dedicated to Islamic decorative arts
notes: Stunning architecture throughout. Allow 2-3 hours to explore collections fully.

name: Thean Hou Temple
description: Ornate six-tiered Chinese temple with traditional architecture
notes: Particularly stunning when lit up at night. Offers panoramic city views.

name: Bukit Bintang
description: KL's premier shopping and entertainment district with major malls
notes: Main shopping hub. Visit Pavilion KL and Lot 10 for varied retail options.

name: Petaling Street
description: Historic Chinatown market street known for bargains and street food
notes: Bargaining expected on goods. Best for street food dining after dark.

name: KLCC Park
description: 50-acre landscaped urban park at the base of Petronas Twin Towers
notes: Nightly fountain show with lights. Perfect for evening strolls with city views.

name: Aquaria KLCC
description: Oceanarium featuring 90m underwater tunnel with marine exhibits
notes: Great for families with kids. Daily feeding sessions are most popular.
